contentrichtext.text: {{Italic title prefixed|3}} Three ships of the [[United States Navy]] have been named '''''Craven''''' after [[Tunis Craven]], a Navy Commander who died at the [[Battle of Mobile Bay]]. * {{USS|Craven|TB-10}}, a torpedo boat, commissioned in 1900 and decommissioned in 1913. * {{USS|Craven|DD-70}}, a [[destroyer]], commissioned in 1918, served in the [[Royal Navy]] as ''Lewes'' until being scrapped in 1945. * {{USS|Craven|DD-382}}, a destroyer, commissioned in 1937 and decommissioned in 1945. ==Source== *{{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/c15-list.htm}} {{Shipindex}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Craven}} [[Category:United States Navy ship names]]
